conclusion: Analyze changes in pressure and volume for the ideal gas from state A to state B and then from state B to state C.
State A has a pressure of 4 atm and a temperature of 127°C.
State B has a pressure of 3 atm and a temperature of 127°C.
Pressure decreases from 4 atm to 3 atm, change in pressure is -1 atm.
Volume increases from 1 L to 3 L.
Heat absorbed is equal to the change in internal energy of the gas.
Change in internal energy is -1 J.
Amount of heat absorbed from state A to state C is -1 J.
